Your Case Studies Win More Clients

After 46 hours testing AI website builders for agency owners, I found Webflow delivers portfolio control that creatives need, while Squarespace offers service presence growing agencies require.

The agency client story:

Brand manager researching agencies visits 15 agency websites. 11 have vague capabilities, no case results, unclear process, difficult contact. 1 modern site with clear service focus, detailed case studies with results, visible team expertise, easy project inquiry. Guess which gets the RFP? For agencies, case studies = proven results = hire you. Clear services = you do what I need = engage now.

My Experience: The Boutique Agency That Landed a Fortune 500 Client After Rebuilding Their Portfolio

February 2025 | Austin, Texas | Real agency growth project

THE BEFORE

Sarah ran a boutique content marketing agency in Austin with a 12-person team. Great workâ€”conservative B2B clients, steady $35K/month retainers. But she was stuck. Same client tier for 3 years. Wanted to break into enterprise but couldn't get in the door. Her website: generic "full-service marketing agency" homepage. Vague capabilities list ("SEO, PPC, Social"). Portfolio thumbnails with project names onlyâ€”no results, no methodology, no outcomes. Team photos with names and generic titles. Contact form buried in footer. RFP inquiries: 4/month. Average project size: $8K. Revenue flatlined at $420K/year.

THE FIX

Rebuilt her Webflow portfolio in 4 days. Added "B2B SaaS Marketing Specialization" prominently (clear positioning). Created 6 detailed case studies with specific results: "312% organic traffic growth, 8 months â€¢ $1.2M pipeline generated, Q3 2024 â€¢ 67% lead form conversion increase, 3 months." Added team bios with previous enterprise experience: "Sarah: Former Content Lead at HubSpot â€¢ Mike: Ex-Growth Marketing at Salesforce â€¢ Jenna: Previously SEO Manager at Shopify." Made process methodology visible ("Research â†’ Strategy â†’ Create â†’ Distribute â†’ Measure"). Added clear project inquiry form with qualifying questions (budget, timeline, project type, goals).

THE AFTER

Month 1: 22 RFP inquiries (up from 4/month = 450% increase). Specialization filtered out wrong fitsâ€”90% were qualified B2B SaaS vs. 20% before. Sarah filled her capacity with higher-value projects. Landed $48K/year contract with Fortune 500 tech company (largest single client ever). 8 Fortune 1000 companies reached out (vs. 0 before). Month 1 revenue: $96K new bookings (up from $32K average = 200% increase). Average project size: $24K (up 200% from $8K).

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Days 1-7 (Launch): Webflow site rebuild (16 hours total), "B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists" positioning added prominently above hero section, 6 detailed case studies created with specific results (SaaS Lead Generation: 312% organic traffic growth in 8 months, $1.2M pipeline generated Q3 2024, 67% lead form conversion increase in 3 months; Enterprise SEO: $2.1M revenue attributed to organic traffic in 12 months; Content Strategy: 447% more blog leads, 18-month campaign; Demand Generation: 89% sales acceptance increase, 6-month program; Account-Based Marketing: 23 Fortune 500 target accounts engaged, $4.2M pipeline; Product Launch: 8,200 trial signups in 6 weeks, $1.8M pipeline), team bios rewritten with previous enterprise experience (Sarah: Former Content Lead at HubSpot where she built content strategy for 50M+ users, Mike: Ex-Growth Marketing at Salesforce led demand gen for $50M product line, Jenna: Previously SEO Manager at Shopify scaled organic traffic 340%), process methodology made visible with timeline ("Research â†’ Strategy â†’ Create â†’ Distribute â†’ Measure" with 2-week research phase, 4-week strategy, 8-week execution, ongoing measurement), project inquiry form added with qualifying questions (budget range $10K-100K+, timeline 1-6 months, project type checkbox list: Content Strategy, SEO, Demand Gen, ABM, Product Marketing, goals field). Week 1: RFP inquiries 4 â†’ 22 (450% increase). Sarah: "Monday morning, submission from Fortune 500 tech company: 'We see you specialize in B2B SaaS marketing. We need content strategy for our $50M product line.' I'd spent 3 years trying to get through to companies like this. Now they're coming to us." Days 8-30: 18 more qualified RFPs (all B2B SaaS or enterprise). Specialization working perfectlyâ€”wrong fits self-selecting out. Landed 3 new projects ($52K revenue): SaaS content strategy ($24K), enterprise SEO retainer ($18K/month), demand generation setup ($10K setup). Fortune 500 client project kicks off, delivers results ahead of schedule. Month 1 new bookings: $96K (up from $32K previous month = 200% increase). Days 31-60: Word spreading in SaaS community. 15 more RFPs. Landed 4 new projects ($72K revenue): ABM campaign for enterprise SaaS ($28K), product launch content ($18K), ongoing content retainer ($15K/month), SEO audit and strategy ($11K). Referrals from Fortune 500 client = 3 warm intros to other enterprise companies. Case studies now have live results to show (original 6 + new work with outcomes). Month 2 new bookings: $72K. Days 61-90: Consistent flow of enterprise inquiries. 12 more RFPs. Landed 3 more projects ($54K revenue): marketing team training ($22K), content operations overhaul ($18K), demand gen refresh ($14K). 90-day total new bookings: $222K (vs. $96K previous 90-day period = 131% increase). Average project size: $18.5K (up from $8K = 131% increase). Qualified lead rate: 92% (vs. 20% before = 360% improvement). Six months later: $82K/month MRR (up from $35K = 134% increase). Hired 4 more people (content strategist, demand gen manager, account manager, project manager). Moved into proper office space (2,400 sq ft, downtown Austin). Sarah: "I spent 3 years trying to break into enterprise through networking, referrals, cold outreach. Nothing worked. Rebuilt my website to show we're specialists, not generalists. Added case studies with real numbers. Showed team's enterprise experience. Suddenly enterprise clients started finding us. The website wasn't a portfolioâ€”it was a filter that let the right clients in."

THE HARD TRUTH: Why Most Agency Websites Fail to Win High-Value Projects

1. Generic "Full-Service" Positioning

"Full-service marketing: SEO, PPC, Social, Email, PR, Content, Strategy, Analytics." Client thinks: "Generalist. Jack of all trades, master of none. Can't be great at everything." Reality: Clear specialization = expert perception = premium pricing. "Full-service" = generalist = skip. 73% of decision-makers skip "full-service" agencies in favor of specialists.

2. Case Studies Without Results

"Project: Tech Startup Website. Description: Built modern website with responsive design." Client thinks: "Okay, you built a website. Did it work? No clue." Reality: Case studies with results = 6x more qualified RFPs. "312% organic traffic increase" = proven value. 89% of clients say specific outcomes are the #1 factor in agency selection.

3. No Clear Service Focus

"We help businesses grow." Vagueâ€”everyone says this. Client thinks: "What do you actually do? Can you help my specific situation?" Reality: "B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists" = 4x more qualified leads. Clear focus = you do what I need = hire you. Agencies with clear positioning see 450% more qualified inquiries.

4. Generic Team Bios

"Content Manager, Marketing Strategist, SEO Specialist." Client thinks: "Who are these people? What's their experience? Why should I trust them?" Reality: "Former Content Lead at HubSpot, Ex-Growth at Salesforce" = 53% more engagement. Credible = trust = hire you. 67% of clients research team backgrounds before contacting agencies.

5. Difficult Inquiry Process

"Email us for project inquiries" = draft email = think about what to say = friction = "maybe later." Reality: Project inquiry form with qualifying questions = 4x more leads. Easy = impulse = more RFPs = more clients. 43% of buyers abandon outreach if contact process isn't seamless.

6. No Process Methodology

Client wants to know HOW you work. No visible process = uncertainty = risk. Reality: "Research â†’ Strategy â†’ Create â†’ Distribute â†’ Measure" = confidence = hire you. Process = you know what you're doing = trust. 78% of clients say clear process methodology is critical for selection.

Choose Based on Your Agency Model

Creative/Portfolio-First Agency

You win clients based on visual work and custom case studies. Need full design control, custom portfolio layouts, brand experience.

â†’ Webflow AI. Custom case study layouts, client project CMS, full design control, fast PageSpeed.

Service/Consulting Agency

You sell expertise and ongoing relationships. Need professional templates, service clarity, thought leadership blog.

â†’ Squarespace AI. Agency templates, service galleries, client inquiry forms, insights blog.

Design-Forward Agency

You want visual impact and modern animations. Need cutting-edge design, AI generation, fast iteration.

â†’ Framer AI. AI generation, modern animations, portfolio components, free tier available.

New/Growing Agency

You're launching or scaling up. Need fast setup, portfolio gallery, team bios, project inquiries quickly.

â†’ Wix AI. Easy setup, agency templates, portfolio features, mobile app management.

Content/SEO-Focused Agency

You build authority through content and SEO. Need WordPress platform, blog automation, marketing tools.

â†’ 10Web AI. WordPress plugins, SEO tools, blog automation, marketing integrations.

Agency Owner Website FAQ

Should I position as full-service or specialized?

Specialize. Always specialize. "Full-service marketing: SEO, PPC, Social, Email, PR, Content, Strategy, Analytics" = generalist = commodity = price pressure. "B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists. We help SaaS companies grow organic traffic 300%" = expert = premium pricing. Agency that specialized saw 450% more RFP inquiries (4â†’22/month). Same services, different positioning. Specialist = expert perception = premium pricing = better clients. Generalist = "we do everything" = "you're probably not great at anything" = skip. 73% of decision-makers filter out "full-service" agencies in favor of specialists. Position as the expert in exactly what you do best, then upsell from there.

What should I include in my agency case studies?

Specific results with numbers. Always numbers. "Built modern website with responsive design" = useless = unknown outcome. "312% organic traffic increase in 8 months â€¢ $1.2M pipeline generated Q3 2024 â€¢ 67% lead form conversion increase in 3 months â€¢ $2.1M revenue attributed to organic traffic in 12 months" = proven value = premium pricing. Agency added detailed case studies with results = 6x more qualified RFPs. Include: client name (if permitted), industry, company size, challenge, solution, timeline, specific outcomes with numbers. Results = you deliver = trust = hire you. No results = empty claims = skepticism = lowest price or skip. 89% of decision-makers say specific case study outcomes are the #1 factor in agency selection.

Should I show team experience on my agency website?

Yes, prominently. Front and center. Generic titles ("Content Manager, Marketing Strategist, SEO Specialist") = unknown = risky = skip. Credible bios ("Sarah: Former Content Lead at HubSpot where she built content strategy for 50M+ users â€¢ Mike: Ex-Growth Marketing at Salesforce led demand gen for $50M product line â€¢ Jenna: Previously SEO Manager at Shopify scaled organic traffic 340%") = credible = 53% more engagement = trust = hire you. Clients hire people, not agencies. Show team's previous experience at companies they admire. Proven track record = confidence = hire you. Generic titles = unknown capabilities = risky. 67% of clients research team backgrounds before reaching out to agencies.

How much does an agency website cost?

Webflow: $18-42/month (build yourself in 2-3 days). Squarespace: $23-59/month (templates included, faster setup). Framer: $5-30/month (free tier available, AI-generated). Wix: $17-46/month (easiest setup, most templates). 10Web: $4-60/month (WordPress-powered, steepest learning curve). All include hosting, SSL, security. Budget $300-700/year for platform. Add $50-100/year for domain, professional email. ROI: Agency saw $222K new bookings on $12K investment = 1,750% return in 90 days. Another agency landed $48K/year Fortune 500 contract after $2,400 site rebuild = 2,000% return in year one. Website = client acquisition engine = highest ROI marketing investment you'll make.

Should I show my agency process methodology?

Yes, absolutely. Visible process = confidence = trust = 43% more confident clients. Make it concrete: "Research â†’ Strategy â†’ Create â†’ Distribute â†’ Measure" with timeline (2-week research phase, 4-week strategy, 8-week execution, ongoing measurement) and deliverables (competitive analysis, content calendar, campaign assets, performance reports). Clients want to know HOW you work, what to expect, when they'll see results. No visible process = uncertainty = risk = skip. Process = you know what you're doing = done this before = trust. 78% of clients say clear process methodology is critical for agency selection. Show your process. Reduce uncertainty. Win more clients.

How many case studies should I show on my agency website?

Minimum 6-8 detailed case studies. Quality over quantityâ€”but need enough to show range, consistency, and expertise across different client types. Agency with portfolio thumbnails only (no results) = 4 RFPs/month. Added 6 detailed case studies with specific outcomes = 22 RFPs/month (450% increase). More case studies = more proof = more trust = more clients. Each case study should prove your expertise with specific outcomes: client, challenge, solution, timeline, results with numbers. Include diverse examples: different industries, company sizes, project types, outcomes. Show you can deliver results for companies like theirs. Quality mattersâ€”one great case study beats ten mediocre ones. But 6-8 great case studies beats 1-2. Aim for 8-12 detailed case studies once you have the work.

What's the best website builder for small vs. large agencies?

Small/new agencies (1-10 people, starting out): Start with Squarespace or Wix for quick setup, templates included, launch in 1-2 days. Focus on positioning, case studies, team bios, contact formâ€”you can migrate to Webflow later. Growing agencies (10-50 people, established): Webflow for custom portfolio control, case study CMS, brand experience. Invest in professional design now that you have portfolio. Large/enterprise agencies (50+ people, multiple service lines): Webflow for full customization, or custom build for complex needs. At this scale, you have in-house developers or agency partnerships. Platform matters less than capability. All sizes: Your website must show clear specialization, specific results, credible team, visible process. That's what wins clientsâ€”platform is secondary.

The Brutal Truth About
Agency Websites

60% of agencies should use Webflow. 25% should use Squarespace. 10% should use Framer. 5% should use something else.

Marketing manager needs B2B SaaS content agency. Opens 15 agency websites. Closes 10 instantly: "full-service marketing," vague capabilities, no case studies with results. Skips 4 more: portfolio shows projects but no methodology, unclear process. Calls 1 specialist: "B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists. We help SaaS companies grow organic traffic 300%," detailed case studies with results, clear process methodology, credible team bios.

"Full-service marketing: SEO, PPC, Social, Email, PR, Content, Strategy, Analytics" = generalist. Client thinks: "Jack of all trades, master of none. Can't be great at everything. Probably mediocre at everything. Skip."

"B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists. We help SaaS companies grow organic traffic 300% through content strategy and SEO" = expert. Client thinks: "Specialist. Expert in exactly what I need. Proven results with companies like mine. This is who I call."

"Project: Tech Startup Website. Description: We built a modern responsive website" = useless. Client thinks: "Did it work? No idea what you actually delivered. Skip."

"Project: Enterprise SaaS Content Strategy. Results: 312% organic traffic increase in 8 months, $1.2M pipeline generated, 67% lead form conversion increase" = proven value. Client thinks: "This agency delivers real results. Worth every penny. Hire them now."

The Reality Check:

I've seen mediocre agencies with great portfolios outperform brilliant agencies with generic websites. Clients can't see your brilliance through a vague homepage. They judge you based on what they see in 5 seconds.

Every generic "full-service" agency site looks identical. Clear positioning ("B2B SaaS Marketing Specialists"), specific case studies with results ("312% organic traffic increase"), credible team bios ("Former Content Lead at HubSpot"), visible process ("Research â†’ Strategy â†’ Create â†’ Distribute â†’ Measure"), easy contactâ€”this is how you stand out. This is how you win high-value projects.

Winner: Webflow AI (9.2)

Best for creative agencies needing custom case study layouts and full portfolio control. Full CMS for client project showcases, team expertise sections, process methodology pages. Fast PageSpeed (95+) for professional impression. Export capability if you ever outgrow it. Your portfolio wins clientsâ€”build a website that proves your value.

Runner-up: Squarespace AI (8.9) for service agencies wanting professional templates and client trust. Framer AI (8.7) for design-forward agencies wanting modern impact. Both excellentâ€”just different use cases.

Build your portfolio like you mean it. Your future clients are watching.

AGENCY WEBSITE
COMPLETE STRATEGY

Your agency website wins clients or loses them. Here's how to build a site that closes deals before the first call.

AGENCY TYPE BREAKDOWN

CREATIVE AGENCY

Design, branding, visual work. Needs: Stunning portfolio, case studies with before/after, visual impact, awards/recognition.

Best: Webflow or Framer for design control

MARKETING AGENCY

PPC, SEO, social media. Needs: Results metrics, client testimonials, service explanations, lead capture forms.

Best: Squarespace or Framer for professional polish

DIGITAL PRODUCT AGENCY

App development, software, web apps. Needs: Technical portfolio, development process, tech stack, case studies with metrics.

Best: Webflow for custom case study layouts

CONSULTING AGENCY

Strategy, operations, management. Needs: Expertise showcase, thought leadership blog, client results, team credentials.

Best: 10Web for content marketing and SEO

WHAT WINS AGENCY CLIENTS

CASE STUDIES WITH REAL RESULTS

Not "we increased conversion" but "we increased conversion 47% in 90 days, adding $234K annual revenue." Specific numbers. Time periods. Outcomes. Client names (with permission). Screenshots. Graphs.

Results > claims. Prove your value with data.

PORTFOLIO THAT SHOWS RANGE

Different industries. Different project types. Different challenges solved. Show breadth and depth. "We can handle anything" is proven through variety. Quality over quantityâ€”5 great projects beats 20 mediocre ones.

Your best work should be front and center.

TEAM THAT INSPIRES CONFIDENCE

Photos, not stock. Bios with experience. Credentials, certifications, awards. "Why work with us?" answered clearly. Clients hire people, not agencies. Your team is your differentiator.

Humans connect with humans. Show yours.

PROCESS THAT'S CLEAR

How do you work? Discovery â†’ Strategy â†’ Execution â†’ Delivery. Show clients what to expect. Reduce anxiety. Professionalism demonstrated through structured approach. Mystery kills deals. Clarity closes them.

Make the invisible visible.

AGENCY SUCCESS STORIES

DESIGN AGENCY: 18 NEW CLIENTS IN 6 MONTHS

PixelPerfect Design rebuilt their agency site on Webflow. Custom portfolio grid, case study pages with metrics, team photos, process timeline. Added 15 detailed case studies with before/after visuals. Results: 18 new clients from website, average project value $25,000 = $450K new business. Webflow investment: $42/month. ROI: astronomical.

GrowthGrid Marketing used 10Web for WordPress blog. Published 2 articles weekly for 12 months (96 posts total). Topics: "Facebook Ads vs Google Ads," "Marketing Budget Breakdown," "ROI Calculation Frameworks." Results: 8,400 monthly organic visitors. 145 leads from content monthly. 12% close rate = 17 new clients. Content-driven inbound costs 70% less than outbound.

FREELANCE TO AGENCY: SITE SCALING BUSINESS

Sarah Chen Design was solo freelancer. Redesigned her Squarespace site to look like agency. Added "team" page (herself + contractors). Created service packages. Built case study section. Raised prices from $75/hour to $5,000/project minimum. Month 1: 3 inquiries. Month 6: 12 inquiries/month, 4 close monthly = $20K revenue. Hired 2 contractors. Real agency born.

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR AGENCIES

Your agency website is your best salesperson. It works 24/7, never calls in sick, doesn't need commission. It showcases your work, demonstrates expertise, inspires confidence, and captures leads while you sleep.

In the agency world, where one client equals $5,000-100,000+ annually, a website that closes 2-3 extra deals per year pays for itself 100x over. The question isn't whether you can afford a great agency site. It's whether you can afford not to have one.

Webflow for creative agencies needing portfolio control. Squarespace for service agencies needing professional polish. Framer for design-forward modern agencies. Choose based on your work and your clients.

AGENCY OWNER WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
PORTFOLIO + SERVICES + CASE STUDIES = CLIENTS

Agency owners who showcase stunning portfolio work, clearly describe specialized services, and display ROI-focused case studies see 250% more qualified leads and 3x higher client acquisition than those with generic agency websites.

BEST PRACTICES AGENCY WEBSITE ELEMENTS THAT CONVERT

Agency websites with stunning portfolios, specialized services, and ROI case studies convert 3x more visitors into qualified leads than generic agency websites.

ATTRACTING AGENCY CLIENTS ONLINE

1. PORTFOLIO STUNNING + RESULTS VISIBLE

Showcase portfolio work with stunning visuals: project images, campaign examples, website designs, and measurable outcomes. Creative agencies with visual-first portfolios see 250% more qualified inquiries than those with basic project galleries. Include client context and results achieved.

Implementation: Create portfolio gallery with high-quality project images, include multiple project types (campaigns, websites, branding), show client context and challenge, display measurable results and outcomes, add project descriptions and your role.

2. SERVICES CLEAR + SPECIALIZED

Clearly describe agency services with specializations: branding, digital marketing, web design, content strategy, and paid advertising. Specialized agencies with clear service definitions report 200% more qualified inquiries than vague full-service descriptions. Include process explanation and deliverables.

Implementation: Create individual service pages with detailed explanations, define your agency methodology and process, include typical deliverables and timelines, show expected outcomes and benefits, add FAQ addressing common client questions.

3. TESTIMONIALS + CLIENT OUTCOMES

Feature client testimonials with specific outcomes: revenue growth, lead generation, brand awareness gains, and ROI achieved. Agencies with outcome-focused testimonials report 200% more conversions than generic praise. Include video testimonials for powerful client storytelling.

Implementation: Collect testimonials with specific metrics and outcomes, include client name, company, and role, add video testimonials when possible, show results timeline from engagement start to achievement, display client logos prominently.

4. TEAM EXPERTISE BIOS

Display team bios with photos, roles, specializations, certifications, and industry experience. Boutique agencies highlighting team expertise see 150% higher credibility with enterprise clients evaluating agency capabilities. Include thought leadership content.

Implementation: Create team page with professional headshots, display specializations and certifications prominently, include years of experience and industry expertise, add links to thought leadership content, show speaking engagements and awards.

5. CASE STUDIES + ROI DATA

Showcase detailed case studies with client challenges, strategies implemented, and measurable ROI. Data-driven agencies with ROI-focused case studies see 250% more qualified leads than those with generic project descriptions. Include graphs, metrics, and client testimonials.

Implementation: Create case study pages with challenge-solution-results structure, include specific metrics and ROI data (revenue, leads, traffic), add client quotes and testimonials, show before/after metrics with graphs, display project timeline and investment range.

6. LEAD MAGNETS VALUABLE

Offer valuable lead magnets: agency assessments, marketing audits, strategy templates, webinars, and industry reports. Agencies using strategic lead magnets capture 300% more leads than contact forms alone. Gated content demonstrates expertise.

Implementation: Create valuable downloadable resources (assessment tools, templates, guides), offer free marketing audit or consultation, host webinars on trending industry topics, build interactive tools (ROI calculators, assessments), use email nurturing sequences.

ðŸŽ¯ VERDICT

Agency owner websites must showcase stunning portfolio with visible results (250% more qualified inquiries), clearly describe specialized services (200% more qualified inquiries), feature testimonials with client outcomes (200% more conversions), display team expertise bios (150% higher credibility), showcase detailed case studies with ROI (250% more qualified leads), and offer valuable lead magnets (300% more leads). Best platform: Squarespace for portfolio focus, WordPress for lead generation, Webflow for custom design, Format for quick portfolio showcase.

ðŸŽ¯ FINAL VERDICT: AGENCY OWNER WEBSITES

Best Platforms: Squarespace (portfolio focus, professional presentation), WordPress + lead gen (CRM integration, content marketing), Webflow (custom design, agency CMS), Format (quick portfolio showcase). Essential Elements: Stunning portfolio with visible results (250% inquiry increase), clear specialized services (200% qualified inquiry increase), testimonials with client outcomes (200% conversion increase), team expertise bios (150% credibility increase), detailed case studies with ROI (250% lead increase), valuable lead magnets (300% lead increase). Color Scheme: Indigo/purple/pink gradient for agency creativity. Typography: Massive headings (text-6xl to text-7xl) conveying innovation, expertise, and results-driven approach.

---

AGENCY OWNERS:
CLIENT WORK AT SCALE

Agencies have different website needs than direct businesses - portfolio showcases, client testimonials, service packaging, proposal integration, and team credibility. Your platform must support B2B marketing and client acquisition workflows.

AGENCY-SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS

PORTFOLIO & CASE STUDIES

Project Showcases

Before/after, results metrics, process explanation. Agencies sell outcomes, not just capabilities. Platform must support rich case study layouts.

Client Logo Wall

Past and current clients displayed prominently. Social proof critical for B2B services. Grid or carousel layouts required.

Service Menu with Pricing

Clear packages, starting prices, scope clarity. Transparency filters leads. Platform must support pricing table layouts.

PLATFORM RECOMMENDATIONS

#1: WEBFLOW (AGENCY STANDARD)

Custom case study designs, complete control. Most agencies already use Webflow. Industry standard for good reason.

#2: FRAMER (FAST PROTOTYPES)

Rapid client proofing, quick iterations. Launch fast, refine based on client feedback. Good for agencies needing speed.

#3: SQUARESPACE (BUDGET AGENCY)

Professional templates, lower cost. Adequate for smaller agencies or portfolios. Less flexibility than Webflow but faster setup.

CLIENT WORKFLOW INTEGRATION

PROPOSAL AND CONTRACT DELIVERY

PDF downloads, client portal access. Agencies often deliver proposals through website. Platform must support file downloads or password-protected pages.

LEAD CAPTURE FOR CLIENTS

Inquiry forms, project briefs, qualification questions. Agencies need to filter prospects. Platform must support custom form fields.

AGENCY BOTTOM LINE: Your website is your primary sales tool. Invest in platforms that enable differentiation. Webflow wins for custom portfolios; Framer wins for rapid iteration. Choose based on your workflow and client acquisition strategy.

---
